channel.title: Heather Brandt's Github Website
channel.description: Recent content on Heather Brandt's Github Website

item.title: Bolt Era: Is Nebraska back?
item.description: library(tidyverse) library(ggalt) teamhitting <- read_csv("Baseball Hitting Stats.csv") teampitching <- read_csv("Baseball Pitching Stats.csv") runsscored <- teamhitting %>% rename(RunsScored = R) %>% select(Season, School, RunsScored) runsallowed <- teampitching %>% select(Season, School, R) %>% rename(RunsAllowed = R) runs <- runsscored %>% full_join(runsallowed) %>% mutate(SchoolSeason = paste(School, Season, sep=" ")) ## Joining, by = c("Season", "School") current <- runs %>% filter(Season == "2021") nu <- runs %>% filter(School == "Nebraska" & Season == "2021") ggplot() + geom_point(data=current, aes(x=RunsScored, y=RunsAllowed)) + geom_point(data=nu, aes(x=RunsScored, y=RunsAllowed), color="red") thisseason<- teampitching %>% filter(Season == "2021", Conference == "Big Ten") ggplot() + geom_dumbbell( data=thisseason, aes(y=reorder(School,SO), x=SO, xend=BB), size = 2, colour = "light gray", colour_x = "black", colour_xend = "red")+ theme_minimal()+ labs(y="Strikouts", x= "Team", title = "Husker's Pitching Showing Promise", subtitle ="") lastsixseasons<- teamhitting %>% filter(School == "Nebraska") ggplot() + geom_line(data=lastsixseasons, aes(x=Season, y=OBPct))

item.title: Are college basketball's blue bloods really that bad?
item.description: For the first time since 1976, college basketball's blue bloods won't be heading to the Big Dance. Anyone who watches college basketball knows that this is not something you would expect from either team. However, with everything surrounding the global pandemic, are we really surprised by much at this point? So what may have factored into these teams not making it into the tournament? Well, let's start by looking at Duke and Kentucky's strength of schedule vs.

item.title: About Heather Brandt
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
